answers.answer: Yes, Diabetics received Kidney transplants all the time. Of course you want to avoid this situation if possible, but there is no reason he can't have one if needed due to his diabetes.

question: Hi guys, my name is Lory and just last week my father started getting really depressed and sick. Well he is diabetic and during the years when he was young and found out he had diabetis he never took care of it, just bearly some years back when he started getting sick more often and his eyesight started messing up on him. Well just yesterday he had a exam on his kidneys and he was not doing that well on them, my question is can i(his daughter) try to see if i can give him one of my kidneys to see if i can save him from anything...im really desperate since i just recently got married and moved out of town to Houston tx and my parents stayed in Laredo Tx. If anybody can help me out with this question of mine or any comments, please let me know, Thx!!
title: Can a diabetic receive a kidney transplant?
